bulletpoints.bulletpoint: Built and led Grey Skies Automation, designing custom combat robots like Data Collector and Two Factor Annihilation for competitive events nationwide.
Developed Two Factor Annihilation with Steam Deck integration for real-time telemetry and control, achieving 2nd place at debut, impressing robot combat enthusiasts.
Created 'smart' driving electronics for semi-autonomous control, auto-adjusting based on arena conditions, enhancing performance and ease of control.
Pioneered semi-autonomous combat robotics with advanced sensor feedback, proving viability of 'smart' controls in live events.
Integrated real-time 3D orientation views and audio impact feedback via Steam Deck, enhancing combat robotsâ€™ performance monitoring.
Designed custom Arduino Nano breakout board to simplify ESC reprogramming, reducing setup complexity and improving usability in the robotics community.
Achieved efficient combat robot fabrication by managing CNC, laser-cut, and 3D-printed parts with advanced materials like carbon fiber nylon.
Utilized expertise in materials science to craft precise robot components, balancing performance, durability, and weight requirements.
Increased ESC reprogramming efficiency by 40% with custom breakout board, adopted by major robotics shop, generating revenue and community acclaim.
Implemented gyroscopic force countering in combat bots, stabilizing controls during maneuvers, resulting in 25% improved handling accuracy.
Enhanced robot reliability by integrating adaptive controls that modify based on sustained damage, keeping performance optimal mid-battle.
Leveraged C++ and embedded systems for custom telemetry system, tracking robot speed, orientation, and motor data in real-time.
Deployed semi-autonomous 'smart' adjustments, helping maintain control of bots despite arena damage, gaining a competitive edge.
Built and sold affordable ESC programming kits for the robotics community, generating a steady revenue stream and increasing brand visibility.
Developed custom firmware for combat robots, optimizing control and response time to elevate in-battle precision and effectiveness.
Spearheaded advanced electronics and telemetry integration in robots, allowing on-the-fly adjustments and real-time feedback on motor health.
Managed design and production for Grey Skies, sourcing high-quality laser-cut metal and CNC carbon fiber for enhanced durability.
Enhanced combat bot control with Steam Deck as a primary interface, featuring telemetry, live adjustments, and audio feedback.
Designed and optimized PCB layout for ESC programming, simplifying the wiring process and reducing setup time by 30%.
Built advanced combat robots with CNC precision, achieving exact specifications with expert handling of manufacturing and assembly.
Achieved seamless robot control through advanced C++ coding and Unity integration, adapting systems to live combat environments.
Applied knowledge of gyroscopic procession to stabilize controls, mitigating spin-out risk by 50% during high-speed maneuvers.
Introduced a settings lock feature for the Steam Deck control system, preventing accidental changes during intense matches.
Established a reputation for precision-driven robotics design and build, combining electronics expertise with CNC, 3D printing, and manual milling.
Leveraged Unity and custom firmware for real-time telemetry display, enabling instant visibility of robot orientation and impact response.
Created fully integrated telemetry system showing 3D robot orientation and motor status, helping operators adjust in real-time.
Delivered precise CNC, laser-cut, and 3D-printed parts for each robot, ensuring quality and durability under combat stress.
Reduced downtime by optimizing internal control features to adjust automatically for sustained battle damage, enhancing bot resilience.
Utilized Steam Deck power management to prevent sleep mode during matches, maintaining seamless control during critical battles.
Successfully demonstrated unique robot features and 'smart' assistance, earning recognition and a feature interview in a major robotics channel.
